alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:47PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 430 PM MST... At 346 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Morristown, or near Circle City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Areas of blowing dust are also possible. Locations impacted include... Surprise, Wittmann, Circle City and Morristown. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 114 and 136. AZ Route 74 between mile markers 1 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert
